article:
'Pannus' is a medical term for an abnormal layer of fibrovascular tissue or
granulation tissue. Common sites for pannus formation include over the cornea,
over a joint surface (as seen in rheumatoid arthritis), or on a prosthetic heart
valve. Pannus may grow in a tumor-like fashion, as in joints where it may erode
articular cartilage and bone.

The term pannus is often used incorrectly to refer to a panniculus (a hanging
flap of tissue), though pannus can also refer to panniculus adiposus.
